content.title: Post-Revascularization Edema

key_concepts.details: Reperfusion injury, capillary leak, impaired lymphatic drainage
Peaks at 2-4 days; usually resolves over weeks to months
Elevation, compression stockings, diuretics if severe; reassurance
Rule out DVT, compartment syndrome, wound infection

content.clinical_significance: Common self-limited complication that can concern patients
content.statement: Post-Revascularization Edema is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Complications that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
